channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Green Light not working, 20th March
item.description:
The green light on the traffic lights on the A4103 heading towards Princess Elizabeth Way on the corner of Hubble Road isn’t working.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Hubble Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street sign defaced, 20th March
item.description:
The street sign for Castanum Court has been defaced with black spray paint so that the name is partly obscured
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Castanum Court, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant Littering in carpark, 20th March
item.description:
There is constant littering in the little carpark on Falkland Place, to the side of 116 Hesters Way Rd. Rubbish currently consists of filled dog poo bags, tea towels, toilet rolls (?) and various other items. Issue has been reported numetous times to CBH as most is due to a tenant of theirs but the problem persists. It's really awful and embarrassing at the moment so I would be very grateful if it could be cleared up. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 114 Hester's Way Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Verge destroyed by vehicles driving across, 19th March
item.description:
On Gotherington Lane, just before the first unit some of the takeaway traders and delivery drivers are regularly driving over the verge and onto the grassed area. This has totally removed the grass verge, replacing it with mud. As they drive on and off the road mud is being spread over the footpath as well as into the road. Some are also parking part on the footpath and part on the verge. I presume that a notice or talking to the traders and delivery drivers will not result in stopping this as they have been doing it for some time and do not consider it to be unacceptable. Is it possible to have a series of posts in the verge to prevent this from continuing?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 73 Gotherington Lane, Bishops Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Another clanking drain outside the pub on London Road, 19th March
item.description:
Another drain clanking, right outside The Beaufort Arms ST refused to help for years until the road broke apart chucking chunks of tarmac down the road, with a previous clanking drain (Still not completely fixed, they just rotated the drain cover to make it less likely, now refuse to communicate further.) They deem them to be 'low priority' and even completely cancel complaints. It's all day and night, preventing sleeping and quiet enjoyment of homes. It's not low priority if you have to live with it. Please can you encourage them to resolve the constant noise issues this cause?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 159 London Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 50 Gauntlet Road, Abbeymead
